meanings.sent1: The subtile artist painted intricate details on the tiny canvas.
meanings.sent2: Her subtile way of solving puzzles always amazed her friends.
meanings.sent3: The subtile magician made the rabbit disappear with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent4: His subtile manipulation of words left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The subtile dancer moved gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience.

meanings.sent1: The subtile message hidden in the painting was revealed under UV light.
meanings.sent2: Her subtile hints about the surprise party went unnoticed by her sister.
meanings.sent3: The subtile plot twist in the movie left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: His subtile plan to surprise his mom with breakfast in bed worked perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The subtile meaning behind the poem slowly unraveled as she read it again.

meanings.definition: Thin or slender in form or structure
meanings.sent1: The subtile branches of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: Her subtile fingers delicately picked up the fragile glass ornament.
meanings.sent3: The subtile stem of the flower bent under the weight of the dew.
meanings.sent4: The subtile thread held the delicate lace together beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The subtile blade of grass bent under the weight of the tiny insect.
